summary: This document is an email chain between attorney Robert Glassman and an unidentified recipient (likely a prosecutor or investigator) discussing a civil lawsuit filed on behalf of an Epstein victim, media coverage of the case, and planning for investigative interviews with the victim and potential witnesses. It reveals coordination between the victim's legal team and investigators.

events.title: Civil lawsuit filing
events.description: Robert Glassman files a civil lawsuit on behalf of an Epstein victim. The filing is noted in media reports.

events.title: Media coverage of lawsuit
events.description: Multiple news outlets (NY Daily News, NY Post, The Sun, Daily Mail) publish stories about the new civil lawsuit filed by an Epstein victim.

events.title: Investigation meeting planned
events.description: A meeting is scheduled for investigators to interview the victim (Ms. [redacted]) at Robert Glassman's office to discuss travel specifics, corroboration steps, and Ghislaine Maxwell.

keyFacts: A civil lawsuit was filed on behalf of an Epstein victim on January 17, 2020, by attorney Robert Glassman.
The lawsuit received significant media coverage in outlets including the NY Daily News, NY Post, The Sun, and Daily Mail.

Investigators were coordinating with the victim's attorney to interview the victim and contact potential witnesses including family members and acquaintances like Jean-Paul, Howie Simon, Dr. Cabe, and John Larkin.
The victim's mother was identified as a potentially key witness but was reported to be overseas, not in the US.
Judge John Koeltl and Magistrate Barbara Moses were assigned to the civil case.
